Reviews.Title: “Good for its location”
Reviews.Author: RAVoyage
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best bargain and most convenient place to stay for people attending shows at the CBS Studios which is what we did. We stayed in the adjoining building. Our room was very clean, warm and cozy. The service at the front desk, TART restaurant staff and cleaning staff was very nice and friendly. The place is right across the street from the Grove and the Farmers Market, two great places to take a leisurely stroll, eat and people watch. However, even with those places close by, it's a pretty quiet hotel despite the traffic noise.The place is a renovated motel that is very clean and bright. As with older hotels and any places near busy streets, there is going to be some noise. If you are used to living in an apartment building in a busy city, you probably can adapt to it. Sometimes the traffic noise sounded more like calming ocean waves so it wasn't that much of a problem. My tip is to bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper. Other than that, there is nothing to complain about this place. If you are looking for luxury go to another hotel, but if you want a place that provides the basic essentials and is clean and has NO BEDBUGS (which is my #1 concern), you will have no problems staying here! I would definitely stay here again if I were to go to another taping for a show or had business in that part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly cute hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joann R
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. It exceeded my expectations. I stayed here with a couple of friends for 2 nights. The first night we checked in around midnight and the staff was super friendly. There was water bottle's and amazing chocolate chip cookies waiting for us. The hotel was decorated very cute and the restaurant to eat at, TART, was amazing. Had breakfast and dinner there. We played ping pong ball and just overall had a really pleasant stay. I would recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic little park of LA to stay in”
Reviews.Author: Sarah R
Reviews.Content: stayed here last May, chose this hotel as it was recommended in lonely planet and being from little old NZ didnt really want to stay in the heart of hollywood. great hotel, rooms feel very homely and kitchen had all the things we wanted. it had a good restuarant attached which did awesome food and takeaway coffees. best think however was the location, this place is opposite The Grove shopping area which is just so cute and with good shops, and a Whole Foods supermarket and heaps of food places. You can also walk up to the Melrose ave shopping area easily, and the Le Bria Tar Pits (very cool and underrated!). Only down side is getting to Hollywood ave which you need to do via taxi but we cant blame this place for its citys terrible public transport!

Reviews.Title: “Totally overpriced motel revamp”
Reviews.Author: JaneInUK K
Reviews.Content: A well decorated motel -cute, but with still the same structure and paper thin walls. Very pricey for what it is. No welcome greeting by the guy checking us in, his colleague eventually offered us the cookies that we're out for guests. We booked 2 rooms paying on the same credit card but had to go through the check in process twice despite providing all the details when checking in online. Had room on 3rd floor -loud traffic noise, a lot less on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: terrio3
Reviews.Content: We chose The Farmer's Daughter because of its proximity to CBS Television City (right across the street). After paying $60 for the cab from LAX, we weren't in the best of moods and, in the dark, the area and hotel looked a little shabby (don't expect Beverly Hills). We were pleasantly surprised to find a cute clean room with a nice big flat screen TV and very comfortable beds. Had a delicious breakfast at their restaurant, The Tart. We had tickets for Dancing With The Stars and it was easy to run over in the morning to see where to get in line later. The next day we walked several blocks to the La Brea Tar Pit and shopped at The Farmer's Market. We stayed three nights and enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: “It used to be great. Now, maybe a "meh."”
Reviews.Author: Benja764
Reviews.Content: This used to be my favorite hotel in LA. So off-beat, so well located, so friendly. So it's really a tarted-up motel, so what? It's still great. That was my attitude. You have to wonder where they went wrong. We tried to check in on a Sunday night. I know, that's when the least capable manager is on duty but this one takes the cake. Icily "polite" she still managed to convey in no uncertain terms that my wife's request for an extra bed was not only not going to be met, it amounted to an insult to everyone in the hotel, and it showed how unbelievably stupid we were to even request it. It was unnerving. Things did get better when the day-shift crew came in and the usual shiny, happy attitude returned, but by then the damage was done. By then the once charming hotel was exposed as an over-priced, over-hyped motel on Fairfax. At least "Tart" the attached restaurant is as good as ever. Isn't it terrible what a single person with a bad attitude can do to your reputation? Avoid if possible.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time's a charm”
Reviews.Author: Redpatch7
Reviews.Content: We stay here whenever we are traveling to northern California to break up the long drive or when we just need a quick getaway from San Diego. The staff is always friendly and accommodating, the valet service is convenient, and the rooms are comfortable. It's basic, rustic, charming. Perfect for a quick trip with teens!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place and location”
Reviews.Author: Tim B
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this quaint little place located across from the L.A. Farmer's Market, The Grove and the Beverly Center along with all the shops and restaurants on trendy 3rd Street. The staff were great and the adjoining restaurant, Tart, was great.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting stay in refurbished motel”
Reviews.Author: chrissywissy100
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. First time in LA. It feels like a motel 6 refurbished with a theme. Relatively good value for LA, but in a strange location. First impressions was that we were in an unsafe neighborhood, but walk over to farmers market and the grove and it feels completely different, and much more affluent. Room facilities basic, but very clean. Squeeky and very firm bed, shower screamed at you with the water pressure. Probably wouldn't stay again (or visit LA for that matter) , but proximity to farmers market and grove it's definitely abig positive. Great shopping and cheap food options. Lots of variety.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: eensign2
Reviews.Content: What else can I say besides I wouldn't stay anywhere else. From the first night checking in we were treated with kindness and a sense of hospitality rarely found these days. The front desk attendants were exceptional, especially Ted and Ed. Both were extremely helpful and bent over backwards to make sure our stay was nothing less than enjoyable. A true show of integrity though took place even after we had checked out.  As we were literally pulling out of the parking lot our room attendant ran out to our car to give my wife a pair of diamond earrings we had left behind  Wow!  Hope to come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “the poshest strip motel i've ever seen :)”
Reviews.Author: lizcarr78
Reviews.Content: Let me start off saying that they did a great job refurbishing this motel. Funky design ideas inside and out. Borderline affordable, with great service. Stayed in the "No Tell" room - for it's funky and kinky, yes, kinky too! design. Wheat field murals on the wall and mirror on the ceiling over the bed, eh! The location is just as fantastic close to the Farmers market (a must see, must try!) and the Grove. The CBS studios are right across - this little extra together with all else will give you the absolute Hollywood feel :) The most fun hotel I've ever stayed at. If I ever go back to LA I wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Stevieg22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location if you are looking to stay in Hollywood. Right accross the street from CBS Studios where shows like The Price is Right, American Idol and X Factor are taped. This hotel is unique in its styling, clean and offers very friendly service. The Grove and Farmers Market are both conveniently located, visible from the hotel and about a 2-3 minute walk. Great place to grab a quick bite. Free Internet but extra parking charge. Free snacks in the lobby are a nice touch!!

Reviews.Title: “Location is unbeatable and room was very clean”
Reviews.Author: mdrtanner
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Farmer's Daughter multiple times. Our latest visit was in October. I hate the price of the room and I'm always looking for a more reasonable hotel but I keep coming back to Farmers Daughter mostly because of the location. The parking price is also crazy high. Basically, this is an old strip motel that has been updated with hip decor and linens. But it's clean and directly across the street from the Farmers Market. We love to walk there everything for dinner. I didn't have any issues with the staff. There were fresh cookies and my son loved seeing the birds. Tart is a great place to eat but not for the budget minded.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AandK111209
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Farmer's Daughter twice while we were stopping over in LA at the beginning and end of our trip. The first stay was for 2 nights and the 2nd was for 1 night only, but I wish it had been for longer! We were always made to feel very welcome with the warm and efficient service. We loved the cookies and lemonade, as well as all the yummy food at Tart (the restaurant attached). We also loved the location - right across the road from the Grove and the Farmer's Markets - the best place to shop and eat in LA. Overall, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey and unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: rtoblin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Christmas Eve and arrived around 1 AM. The staff member was extremely chatty, which at that time of night all we wanted was to go to bed as we had traveled all day. He also basically insisted that we pay for valet parking for $18 even though the street signs were extremely clear that if we left by a certain time the next day, we'd be fine on the street. He insisted we were wrong and told us multiple stories about tickets and big car crashes from being parked on the street. He was peculiar enough that we were afraid he might call someone, so we just paid it (and it was already our most expensive hotel of our road trip by 50%). After we finally made it to our room, the floors were hardwood, not so nice for our feet and it was sparsely (farm-y?) decorated. It is close to the Grove and the restaurant next door was good. They had bicycles to take around town (though no helmets), which I suppose is nice had we been staying more than 10 hours. We also got a call around 11 AM asking if we were coming down to check out- they did accomodate us when I told them our Orbitz reservation said check-out was noon. But they sure did call right at 11. Overall, I just was not impressed with the value for the room quality or the staff. Disappointing based on the reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Clean & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Cody14
Reviews.Content: Great Location. Staff very pleasant and helpful . Food in house was terrific. Stayed only 1 x night but my daughters have stayed several times on stop overs and always have found it consistently a pleasant stay. Good quiet rooms and the little extras in the foyer like the delicious cookies/ chips/cider/water made it feel very friendly and comfortable, After paying much more at various other hotels on our trip I considered it good value for LA Would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Much nicer than it used to be!”
Reviews.Author: Saralpo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Farmer's Daughter almost thirty years ago with my family. I remember it being very standard motel style. The pool was in a dark gated area and it was a very mediocre experience. Now that one of my kids lives here I come fairly regularly to LA. I was going to stay elsewhere this trip but the kids suggested Farmer's Daughter. I had mixed feelings about trying it again. Anyway, it was very cute. I was greeted with hot apple cider and freshly baked cookies. The lobby was done in the farm style theme. The elevator was copper and classy. The room had the same farm theme. The bed was good. Shower was good . But the overall effect was kind of done on a budget; one piece shower bath, curtains needed another panel. No shower cap, door on the closet or full length mirror. There are outdoor sitting areas for smokers and fresh air and a nice restaurant adjacent. All in all nice but overprice for $180+ a night.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Scott T
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business and was nothing short than impressed! Rooms were clean and quiet. Great location for everything LA. Great food and loved the bar. Staff was as nice as it gets. Coming back for sure. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MannyMack
Reviews.Content: We visit Los Angeles about 5 times a year and either stay in Santa Monica or here at the Farmers Daughter Hotel. Easy and convenient to get to the Farmers Daughter is a perfect spot for traversing Los Angeles. The rooms are really clean and well done, nothing fancy but they are perfectly appoiinted. The restaurant downstairs is really good and well priced and the staff goes out of their way to accommodate you. Really great folks. They saved us a paper in the morning too. The additional charge for parking is fair and the car is always easily available. We actually like it better each time we visit!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back for more of the Farmer's Daughter soon...”
Reviews.Author: DaveLoveless
Reviews.Content: We stayed at FD while searching for Wedding Rehearsal venues in the W Hollywood area. Our son and fiance' knew about this little gem and had already secured a block of rooms for out-of-town guests coming in for the wedding - we thought we would try it out in advance of the June 2012 event and were not disappointed at all!! I'll reiterate what everyone else says... convenient to The Grove and Beverly Center shopping, easy to drive to any place in the Hollywood area, walk to several good restaurants/bars, service is great from front desk, valet, "Tart" staff, event planning, and even the housekeepers. Here's some other things... - Great big jar of caramels, fresh cookies and lemonade await you each day at the front desk! - Bicycles are provided if you want to take a spin rather than hoof it around the neighborhood. - Nice little seating areas at each level allow you to sit in the sun and relax/work in the fresh air without having to go down to the cafe. - Watch out for Joey at Tart... he'll flirt with your wife until she's giddy and calls him "cute as a bug"... but what service from him and his staff!! - KJ can help you plan a great party at this location in the open air atrium... and if my wife thinks Joey is hot, then KJ qualifies as Scorching! Only down sides I saw... Sun never really hits the pool area in January, so don't expect to be sun bathing here... but the sun does come through the blinds very easily early in the a.m. And just one mirror in the suite made it a bit difficult for the wife to get ready for night out when I was at the mirror shaving and such. Highly recommend however!!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky yet good”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Y
Reviews.Content: Rooms decked out in their own unique way from the room furniture to wall colour. Superb location as the grove and farmers market are just a few minutes walk. Grove during the night well decorated with christmas lights/festivity during December and farmers market a food haven. If you prefer to walk further West 3rd street trendy eateries are also just around the corner. Front of desk staff are also ready to assist with any queries. One minor comment is the price per night could be better perhaps some form of discounts for longer stays.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, exceptionally friendly staff, a real bargain for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Geckocrew
Reviews.Content: Bottom line: Outstanding boutique hotel. This is so different from a chain hotel, it doesn't make sense to try to compare it to one. If you want a sterile, cookie cutter, "same as I stayed at in.....", you will be disappointed. If you want unique, friendly and trendy, this is the place to stay. We were attending the 2011 Hollywood Reel Independent Film Festival at the near by, New Beverly Cinema and wanted to stay in the area at a boutique hotel. We were not disappointed. The Farmer's Daughter Hotel appears to have been designed as a quintessential "motor court" in the 50's or 60's. It has been redesigned and they have done an amazing job of working with in the constraints of the original structure. We stayed in room 101, located in a quiet corner of the property. I don't know what the other rooms look like so this is unique to 101. The room is decorated with copper counter tops and accents throughout the room and includes a subtle continuation of the farm theme in the bedding and wall mural. The bedding was very comfortable. The faucet was style like an old fashioned sink pump. The shower was simple but included an adjustable rain style head and there was plenty of hot water. The staff were all very friendly and attentive. They made every attempt to accommodate us as we dealt with the logistics of visitors. They helped us find a great place to eat - "Animal" - just up the street. It didn't matter if it was midnight or 8 am, there was always a smile and helpful attitude. Over all I cannot say enough about the facility and staff. If you are in the West Hollywood area, don't miss the Farmer's Daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and unique boutique hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: GlobalNamaste
Reviews.Content: Farmer's Daughter is a boutique hotel whose location and attention to design make it outperform its physical limitations. It is, like many similar boutique hotels in other cities (Ace, Clarendon, Rumor, etc), a property that was previously less reputable and not constructed as a modern hotel, but which has been retrofitted and renovated in order to serve a class of customers who don't mind trading off some big hotel amenities in order to get a more interesting and distinctive hotel experience. Like these similar boutique hotels, Farmer's Daughter can't entirely hide its flaws beneath good design, but overall the experience usually outweighs the drawbacks. There are two very appealing aspects of the Farmer's Daughter. One is its concept and branding. The entire place is decorated using a farmhouse theme. Think lots of yellow and blue, including plaid/gingham curtains, denim bedspreads, imitation whitewashed plank flooring, large beds, and lots of whimsical paintings of animals and farm life decorating the rooms. There are, of course, many of the usual expected amenities, from flat screen TVs with cable to in-room safes and refrigerators, to an in-house restaurant (TART) that also provides room service. All of these are coordinated with the Farmer's Daughter iconic imagery. You can even buy the official t-shirt ("Do It At The Daughter") at the front desk. But you can also get free cookies and lemonade at the front desk, so it's not just a gift shop. The second appealing aspect of the Farmer's Daughter is its location right in the middle of everything interesting in West Hollywood. If you're trying to get on a CBS game show, the studio is across the street. LACMA and the Petersen Automotive Museum are very close. So is the farmer's market, and a variety of local eateries, some of which are famous (Canter's 24-hour deli). You can see the Hollywood sign from the sidewalk, and you can reach most places from Beverly Hills to Pasadena in a reasonable amount of time by car. Of course, parking stinks. So if you're driving into the Farmer's Daughter, either take advantage of the valet parking (currently about $18/day), or get familiar with the neighborhood and try to find street parking (but beware of street-sweeping exclusions!). Given these two appealing aspects of the Farmer's Daughter, there are probably good reasons to overlook some of its less appealing elements. But not everyone will be able to do this, so I should point out two things that might eliminate the Farmer's Daughter as an option for your next trip. One is that, like every other retrofitted boutique hotel I've ever stayed in, the Farmer's Daughter is loud. Part of this is that LA is loud, especially with traffic noise and external construction. But a big part of it is basically that Farmer's Daughter has thin walls and a lot of activity that causes noise, whether it is A/C units kicking on and off, cleaning machines powering up, or construction noise (e.g. jackhammers in the pool at 9am). It is sometimes difficult to sleep through the night, and light sleepers will not enjoy their Farmer's Daughter experience. The main building is quieter, but this is relative. It is never actually quiet. The other thing that might put off travelers is that the overall condition of the property feels less well-maintained and polished than a large hotel. You're not always sure that the toilet will work (though it does), and large parts of the bathroom seem to be held together with paint. I did not have any problems with maintenance issues, and everything worked completely fine. However, if you are expecting the same level of fit and finish as the W or Four Seasons, you may find the Farmer's Daughter a bit shabby. Ultimately the good far outweighs the bad at Farmer's Daughter, and if you are looking for a charming and unique boutique hotel in a great location, this is about as good as it gets. Light sleepers should look elsewhere, and you shouldn't expect that the physical property will be as perfect as the branding and identity materials. But if you want to remember your stay in Los Angeles, check it out. You'll probably be glad that you did.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in LA. Friendly staff, great lemonade and cookies!”
Reviews.Author: pk_kaufman
Reviews.Content: Read the positive review in the weekend Australian and as we were not going to have a car this time, we wanted to be somewhere we could walk around easily and in LA that is asking something. This quirky hotel (still laid out like a motel) has been fixed up in quaint farmers style (and is opposite the famous Farmers Markets). The bed is very comfortable - the bathroom fine, the air conditioning works well (though a little loud) and the view of the Hollywood sign was fabulous. The wireless internet is free and the bar has a happy hour worth attending. The rates are reasonable (what is unreasonable are the taxes in LA which are plus, plus and plus). Easy to walk around in the area,close to the LACMA and the tar pits and to Melrose and the quirky shops and the buses are frequent as well if you get tired. Loads of great food in the area, at the Farmers market and close by (eg Canters Deli).

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality and location”
Reviews.Author: Ourroadlesstraveled
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you are passing through on your way to say Baja, like we did. They recommended the best Sushi place to us. Very clean and quiet rooms for an inexpensive price.

Reviews.Title: “'Couldn't speak more highly of great staff and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gdoreian
Reviews.Content: Everything about this cute little hotel is great! From the homey little theme rooms to the budgie and cookies at Reception. The whole place and staff were a great base for a visit to Los Angeles. The location-opposite the Farmers Market was a great base to collect suppies. Easy access to West Hollywood sights and shopping. Staff were so welcoming and helpful for a traveller a long way from home. Tart restaurant was also great. Great angus burger and beers. I would recomend The Farmers Daughter to anyone and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of potential but overall disappointing”
Reviews.Author: rpb2654
Reviews.Content: As we pulled up to the Hotel, I thought to myself “what a charming place”. The exterior is tasteful, warm and inviting. The valet was friendly and prompt. We pulled our bags and were off to the front desk. Check-in was courteous and pleasant, all was well. Our room was a short walk from the lobby upstairs. The room was close to the street, in the same building as the lobby, and there was noise but no big deal. The room was clean but something just didn’t feel right. The room wasn’t bad but it was not good either. Of note, our mattress was worn and VERY unsupportive. As we changed to walk across the street to the Grove, a housekeeping person opened the door and walked in. No knock, no announcement, just WALKED right in. She quickly apologized and literally sprinted off, but seriously? Farmers Daughter is across the street from the Grove, which is a plus. We had breakfast Sunday morning at the restaurant onsite. The food is good, ambience warm and friendly, and overall the restaurant area is well done with plenty of umbrella’s and shaded tables to enjoy your meal under the Southern California sun. Overall it is nice, though the service was average. On Sunday morning, housekeeping called us at 10:40AM supposedly for no reason. At 11:30am housekeeping knocked on our door asking if we were checking out. I said yes, and confirmed checkout was noon. The housekeeping person seemed to be pressing us to be out more quickly, like, RIGHT NOW. Three interruptions from housekeeping in less than 24 hours is three too many in my book. Our room was on the outside. The rooms facing into the center of the property are probably a better experience as the inner ambience is warm and inviting while the GNC sign in our window was not. As I looked around during breakfast, the inner part of the hotel was quite nice and I could imagine probably a good experience. Ultimately, the housekeeping interruptions, and at checkout a general lack of concern with guest satisfaction, combined for a will not return. The Valet provided the best service experience at this property and is excluded from the poor service rating.

Reviews.Title: “Pro's and Con's”
Reviews.Author: BCMck
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first 3 nights in LA in September 2011. When we arrived (after 16hrs on a plane) the front desk informed us our room wasnt ready (it was 11am) which was fair enough. So he told us to leave and come back between 1-1.30 which we were happy to do. After walking across the road to the Farmers Market and getting some lunch we returned at 1.45 and were told by a different staff member that our room wasnt ready and check in wasnt until 4pm. We explained the other staff member said we could come back at 1.30 which was met with a strug. So we went and sat in the courtyard and read a book until our room was ready at about 3.30 - not a great start. The rooms themsleves are quite large and in a funky (interesting) decor and were very clean. The thing we liked most about this hotel is its location - directly across from the Farmers market and The Grove shopping strip which in my opinion is one of the best shopping areas in LA. It also meant we could walk over there for lunch, late night dinner and cheesecake and take in a late night movie without having to get a cab home. Would definitely stay again, but they need to update their service levels to be considered a really good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No frills here”
Reviews.Author: mitch s
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last wednesday night. Expected it to be a nice place for the rate. Got to room They have pieces of particle board between the box spring and mattres, looks and felt a little funky. The room i was in was close to the street, so it was pretty loud traffic noise. It s close to coffee and farmers market. Was a little disappointed, for what i paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Cute Hotel”
Reviews.Author: colicol
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location across from the farmers market and the grove shopping centre (and close to metro bus services). Hotel service and restaurant was excellent (free cookies and ice-tea at the front). Rooms were cute but the bathrooms were a little dated (shower curtains / combined shower - bath).

Reviews.Title: “Funky, smaller hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Katey747
Reviews.Content: We booked via expedia and got a great deal on rates. Big, comfortable bed and good size room. Convenient location, and the Tart restaurant attached was great for breakfast and dinner. The Grove shopping complex is just across the road. The staff were friendly and helpful and the place had a good atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location,nice staff”
Reviews.Author: danece
Reviews.Content: Except for lacking coin laundry,the service is nice and friendly.The location is close to the farmer's market and shopping center which is wonderful.Clean room.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel with a lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: JeannieChiliBeanie
Reviews.Content: Location is prime near the Farmer's Market, the Grove, and Television City. Fairfax is a busy commercial street that lacks warmth. Once you walk in the Farmer's Daughter you feel like a person again. The restaurant on premises -- Tart -- serves great fare all day. The rooms are comfortable and cleverly decorated. Nothing fancy, but quite welcoming. We had a sort of wacky assortment of needs in our party (me, my husband, a niece, a friend, my brother, his son...) and the front desk accomodated all of our little peculiarities with pleasant aplomb. I am always happy to get out of the bowels of LA. It's not my thing. But I would definitely stay here again! (parents of children ages 5 - 13 might not want to expose their kids to some of the tackier jokes and sexist tart references, but that was not our party)

Reviews.Title: “Tacky and Terrific”
Reviews.Author: zitabobba
Reviews.Content: We were not sure what to expect from this "bargain" hotel. But, it was great. The tongue and cheek decor was cute and comfortable. The location is stellar. It is right across the street from the Farmer's Market. For us this meant unlimited choices of wonderful ethnic food at great prices. It is also across the street from CBS and The Grove. We had a wonderful time. The staff was friendly, the valet parking very reasonable. The restaurant also served good coffee and food. We plan to stay here again when we visit California next year.

Reviews.Title: “Best cookies in town !!”
Reviews.Author: Alex L
Reviews.Content: Nothing but great experiences.. That's what we had during our trip !! This hotel is amanzingly nice.. Everything from the design to the service is great.. Since the first day, guys from the front desk where so helpful and friendly. The room was awsome !! Try the TART Restaurant.. and ask for a TART Burguer !! OMG !!!! Thanks for the best "lobby cookies" I ever had. !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel, to be recommended but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Demonsbarnyard
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our two kids for 6 nights in the hotel. We re Ally appreciated the service by the staff and the location of this hotel is ideal. With fairfax, melrose and beverrly arounf you cover shopping, eating out and sightseeing without too much effort. Framers Market is on the other side of the road and a great solution for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Rooms are on the expensive side but ok in comparison to other hotels/motels around. Why such a high parking fee in the automobile xity par excellence we haven't understood but parked our car less than 5 minutes away on the street. The pool is very small and not heated, as wel as in the shade but good enoughnto cool down. Rooms are fine even for four people. We willc ome back here, especially forma price around USD 200 which would be fairer than the USD 269 per night we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Firstmmo
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect location for visiting the Grove, the La Brea Tar Pits, the LA County Museums and the Petersen Auto Museum. All within walking distance (3 blocks or less). Each morning you can walk across the street to the Farmer's Market Restaurants and eat until your heart's content: coffee shop, diner, veggie stand, crepe place, donuts, juices. For dinner, there's EVERYTHING you could imagine. We went with our 10 yr old boy and we even fit in a movie at The Grove. This was a great spot too if you are interested in seeing Hollywood as it's not far from here. The hotel itself was cute, and comfortable. It's not luxe, but it's really nicely updated. We had a third floor room (top) and we never heard any other guests but I know there were others staying there. We ate at Tart one morning and it was a very good breakfast. I had some worries that there would be noise from the bar downstairs but we couldn't hear anything in Building one which is across the parking lot. Expect to pay $18 per day for parking. Not cheap, but not the most we've paid either. We left our car there for a whole day and walked to everything. The pool was small and we didn't use it, but I can imagine it might be nice for some families if it was very hot, especially at the end of sight-seeing. The one negative: the staff was very variable. One woman was friendly, professional and quite nice, but the next day at check-out the front clerk was fairly unfriendly, unhelpful and kinda rude. Too bad because it left my last impression on a negative note.

Reviews.Title: “Laid back, comfortable and friendly environment.”
Reviews.Author: Jess288
Reviews.Content: I loved the farm style décor of the hotel. The room was spacious and comfortable. I felt welcomed by the friendly and helpful staff. Thank you for the attention to details such as having fresh lemonade for the guests on the reception area. Much appreciated on a hot summer day. The location is great. Only 2 blocks away from the Grove Shopping area and the Original Farmers Market, so much fun! I will stay again at the Farmer’s Daughter Hotel when I am back to L. A.

Reviews.Title: “Laid back, comfortable and friendly atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: Jessi21
Reviews.Content: I loved the farm style décor of the hotel. The room was spacious and comfortable. I felt welcomed by the friendly and helpful staff. Thank you for the attention to details such as having fresh lemonade for the guests on the reception area. Much appreciated on a hot summer day. The location is great. Only 2 blocks away from the Grove Shopping area and the Original Farmers Market, so much fun! I will stay again at the Farmer’s Daughter Hotel when I am back to L. A.

Reviews.Title: “An Awesome Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: g_lbellcan
Reviews.Content: We can not say enough good things about this boutique hotel and it's staff. It was wonderful! The rooms, although not lush and luxurious, were clean and functional. The staff however were amazing. They were so accommodating and anticipated our every need. We have never been to a hotel that took such good care of us. We would definitely return and will recommend the Farmer's Daughter to others.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and hip"”
Reviews.Author: lucyquaint
Reviews.Content: This small hotel just across from the famed Farmers Market & upscale Grove shopping mall has a retro, been here forever feel, with the most gracious employees anywhere, a fine restaurant (TART), comfortable if simple rooms. The small pool area lacks charm but the rooms and lobby have the farm motif carried out in clever ways. We look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: lullabymoon
Reviews.Content: Love this little hotel for many reasons: The interior design and concept of rustic allure and modern layout is charming. It has many whimsical little details such as the singing birds when you enter the reception. Love the open courtyard with the pool. And best of all it's in a great location right right across from LA's lovely and lively farmer's market.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, quirky little hotel”
Reviews.Author: CheckenT
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night - clean, comfortable and good value for location. Great in house breakfast (extra $$$). Close by all La attractions. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Funky and cool, friendly and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Five15
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. Its and older motel that has been converted to a more funky and cool hotel and it works. The staff are superb, from the mandatory valet parking (18+taxes a day) guys to the reception and the other staff everyone was friendly and helpful, but what really makes this hotel is the location. Being across the road from the Farmers market is a boon and you can eat here for breakfast and dinner with no problem for great value for money. The rooms are not massive and the elevator is small when using the bell hops cart, but the place is clean and the beds are comfy. The only downside was the other guests on a sat night who seem to think that talking loudly on their phones at 2am in the hall was not a problem, but thats not the hotel's fault. All in all a nice hotel in an expensive city that actually looks and feels nice to be in as well as being different.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in LA”
Reviews.Author: MegWesternAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for a 3 days in the middle of June and then again at the end of June for 4 days with our 2 kids - aged 8 and 10. The best thing about the hotel is being opposite the Grove and the Farmer's Market. When you get back from a busy day out with your kids, you don't need to drive anywhere for dinner because you can just go to The Grove. We also loved buying fruit everyday from the Farmer's Market and Wholefoods, which is across the road. Its also right in the middle of all the best shopping in LA. West 3rd street is right around the corner, the Beverly Centre is down the road, Melrose Ave is a few blocks away and ofcourse the Grove is the best of all shopping experiences . There are good breakfast options nearby like Joans on 3rd, Toast, Du Par's and Swingers - all in walking distance. We also had breakfast at the hotel restaurant called Tart. It was great being near Target and Kmart so we could buy extra suitcases and stock up on all the basic items that are $$ in Australia. The only downside to the hotel was that its a little noisy and the curtains don't really keep the light out. But this didnt't really matter because we wanted to make the most of each day and not sleep in and lets face it...LA is a noisy city anyway. While we were in LA we did Universal Studios, The Petersen Car Museum, Madame Taussaud's and The Griffith Observatory and this hotel was close to all of these attractions if you have a car. Another thing...frrom the glass back elevator in the annexe building you can see the Hollywood sign if its a clear day. Valet is $20 a day and every afternoon they have free homemade choc chip cookies and pink lemonade in the reception. Our kids swam in the pool and there is also a table tennis table. There is plenty of TV channels available and fast free wifi in the rooms.Our room had 2 queen size beds and we paid $189 per night. All my friends stay here and we would stay here again too. It is a decent,affordable hotel with friendly staff in a great location

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience!”
Reviews.Author: cherylcampbell13
Reviews.Content: I went with 10 of my friends on a girls trip and we LOVED the farmers daughter!!!! It had a great location. So much to do in the area. Right across the street from CBS studios where they film The Price Is Right, Dancing With the Stars, American Idol and The Young and The Restless. It's across the street from the Grove with great shopping and restaurants. They film "Extra" with Mario Lopez outside at The Grove every dayl We went over and were able to be on film for a taping. Got to meet and talk with Mario. We went to The Price Is Right and someone in our group got called down and won a trip! The staff was fantastic at the hotel!! There is a night front desk person that comes in before his shift to give a class on what to expect if you are going to The Price is Right. The bus comes right on our street and for $1.50 you can go most anywhere. We couldn't have been more thrilled with the hotel! Loved that each room had a refrigerator. It was only $1 for a can of pop from the machine! Free high speed internet in the room! Nice restaurant right on site. Great outdoor seating at the restaurant also!

Reviews.Title: “Big Comfy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: hotone1965
Reviews.Content: I stayed During E3 and the hotel was packed , but the staff remembered my name and i always felt welcomed. The king bed was comfy and despite my size the room felt big. They had Dvds in the lobby to borrow, but the selection was thin. the restaurant was good and the valet helped me with my bags which was nice. this place was a nice surprise for me.

Reviews.Title: “It served it's purpose...”
Reviews.Author: Krishel
Reviews.Content: I've driven past this hotel several times and thought it looked cool so gave it a try. Definitely, it is cool. But it's just a hotel that's been dollied up to look good BUT the walls are thin, the bathrooms aren't new, it has low ceilings. We arrived at 11am after a 14 hour flight and were told that we couldn't check in until 4pm. 2pm would have been ok but 4pm was a bit nasty. Their standard check-in time is 4pm but I didn't realise this when I booked. The location is A1, the Grove is fantastic. The restaurant looked great but was so so. All in all the hotel served it's purpose, it wasn't expensive, it's in a good location, the staff were helpful enough but I'd probably stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great West Hollywood location at the right price”
Reviews.Author: Nessnpete
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights straight off a 13 hour flight and despite turning up earlier than 4pm check - in time the young lady at the desk got us in early to our room to enable a sleep which was greatly appreciated. Bed was good, we were on the 3rd floor and it was quiet, very clean and cool. extremely happy with the room. Tart is fantastic. a great happy hour (s), friendly service and good food at a fair price. we found the staff on reception desk to be inconsistent. we had the full range from extremely helpful and friendly at check in through to surly and forgetful at check out. this is a great place to stay if you aren't afraid of navigating LA buses and walking, you are in proximity to 3rd street cafes, bars and shopping and the sunset nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Walls were paper thin”
Reviews.Author: byelderman
Reviews.Content: The Farmer's Daughter is a nice motel/hotel with a restaurant and valet parking. The rooms are a good size and very comfortable. The only negative thing about it was their paper thin walls. At first our room was right by the ice machine and vending machines. I asked to be moved to a more quiet room. They were very accommodating and moved us to the very end of the complex. The only problem was we could still hear the traffic on Fairfax plus we heard almost every word our next door neighbors said. They should invest in some insulation to handle the noise problem.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient and quirky”
Reviews.Author: aurorahunter
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a mid-priced hotel with a little vibe that's not all the way out in Santa Monica or in the thick of Hollywood, Farmer's Daughter is a good choice. The structure is circa 1960s, but they've updated it to look retro-chic. Rooms are adequately appointed and the front desk does nice things like put out fresh cookies in the afternoon. Location is very central, and you're walking distance from the Farmer's Market and The Grove. My only criticism is that the lighting...especially in the bathroom...could be improved. That's still a throwback to the property's motel past. Also, blackout curtains could help reduce the morning light. Tart, the restaurant attached to the hotel has great food and is a relaxing place to have a drink. not much of a night scene, though. Quirky? Yes. Right down to the shrine in the lobby with winner photos of contestants on The Price is Right (which tapes across the street). It's a bit pricey for what it is. I think a rate of $ 225 / night is about right. But I've never left the place unhappy.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful - the rate quoted in advance may not be the rate you end up being charged"”
Reviews.Author: BazCamp
Reviews.Content: I was in LA for 6 days on business and chose the FD because of location and price. The price I ended up paying was over 20% higher than that on the email reservation confirmation I had received. On checking in I had signed (without reading properly after an 18 hours transatlantic journey) an agreement to pay a higher rate than quoted. I feel this was an incredibly devious and underhand tactic by the hotel and all guests signing in should be aware of this, I was not the only one that had been conned in this way. The hotel itself is quite basic, rooms have basic furnishing, no drawers. The pool is more like a plunge pool, and the bar and restaurant are not open on a Sunday evening.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: LondonKaytee
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location opposite farmers market - lots of choice for shopping, eating, breakfast/snacks. Were there on last day so bought foody presents at the market. Hotel has very indivudal decor on farming theme - made it memorable and individual. Restaurant on site but didn't use. Walking distance of LACMA and other museums (the food trcuks park outside at lunch so you huge choice of good value eats!)

Reviews.Title: “Yes, its farmlike”
Reviews.Author: Reisiger99
Reviews.Content: Terrible stay - dirty rooms (the sticky-floor type) and zero interest in cleaning it from housekeeping after requesting more than once. Disinterested management could not have cared less about any of the (multitude of) issues with this stay. Also did not understand the valet parking at $18 at all - there is more than enough parking in the two lots and the attendant literally drove my car 5 metres in & out of the parking space every time.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice, with cool vibe, great location.”
Reviews.Author: notpicky032
Reviews.Content: Very close to the Grove for great shopping, and the Farmer's Market. It is different and casual in a good way, and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A Quirky and Fun Place to Spend a Weekend”
Reviews.Author: davidj94112
Reviews.Content: While in LA for the weekend (after a family trip to Disneyland) we were looking for a place to stay that had some personality and was different from the "chain" hotels. The Farmer's Daughter perfectly fit the bill. This is not a luxurious place so much as it is a comfortable place. Our room (a Suite, #300) was nice size and included a fridge, stove top, and plenty of nice glassware. It was everything we needed in a room. The rest of the grounds are pretty basic - small pool, ping pong table, some nice seats to lounge in on the second floor. We didn't get a chance to eat at the restaurant (not enough time), but the Sunday brunch sure looked good. The staff were friendly and helpful and the location was great for exploring. Price was a bit more than I would like to pay for such amenities but overall it was still a decent value. I would recommend it for anyone who doesn't care about being pampered and just wants a comfortable, quirky, place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best LA stop-over for shopping and relaxing after long flight”
Reviews.Author: macmark
Reviews.Content: Farmer's Daughter is our favourite LA hotel....so much more fun and charm than anything at touristy Santa Monica or Bev Hills - so we stay here not for the amazing value (which it is) but because it feels more like the real LA to us - casual and quirky. Yes its a basic drive up Motel that has been renovated - but it comes together perfectly. There is great shopping across the road at The Grove and a farmers market for snacks, a Whole Foods supermarket down the street and a number of very cool cafes/breakfast spots within walking distance. We also liked the breakfast at the onsite cafe called Tart.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: MTNR_FAN
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little hotel at a good location, although it seems a little beaten up from outside, butI guess that's the look they want to give. It's a completely different story inside, the rooms are huge, beds are comfortable and most important is the friendly staff. They were very nice and accommodating to all our requests and questions, even the manager was very helpful. The hotel is located within 10 minutes of driving distance to Hollywood Walk of Fame and Beverly Hills, the parking costs $18 but I think that's the best option in LA. The breakfast is good and reasonably priced. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for it's quality as it gives you your dollar's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: brndsgn
Reviews.Content: I personally loved the Farmer's Daughter Hotel. Amazingly helpful and friendly staff - even after having an issue with 2 hotel keys - they were quick to replace them and got us right into the room. The room was pretty large and clean, nice design without "down on the farm". Didn't really care for the view of the parking lot via the only window in the room, but we weren't staying here to gaze out the window. The location was perfect too - close to WeHo hot spots, and right across the street from the Grove shopping area and farmer's market (must visit!). I would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, LOVE this place”
Reviews.Author: wasabipink
Reviews.Content: First time in LA and had no clue where to stay. The Farmers Daughter is adorable, great location and super friendly & helpful staff. The parakeets, cookies and lemonade in the lobby were a great touch...visiting from VA, we felt right at home! TART (restaurant on site) was amazing - waitstaff ALL super nice and the food was fabulous! I'm very picky as to where I stay when I travel (cleanliness, customer service, etc...) - NO REGRETS here...I can't wait to visit LA again and will def stay at The Farmers Daughter again!

Reviews.Title: “Great service & Location”
Reviews.Author: lbouchie
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel while visiting the Price is Right the first time a few years ago. We have been back 3 times and love staying here. The location is perfect to site see to about anywhere. The Grove has a theater that we enjoyed and Farmer's Market has so much great food & there is also a Whole Foods & coffee shops within a block. I have never felt unsafe here either. The last two years I traveled here alone with my son and stayed a week. For a small town Indiana mother this place & area always feels safe and like home to me!!1

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: overdue1
Reviews.Content: My grandaughter and I traveled from Gainesville, Florida to visit the Price is Right. We only had to walk across the street to get in line and didn't have to rent a car, convenience is what you really pay for. We felt secure and did not worry about safety. We were able to walk to the Farmer's Market to shop and eat.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, over-hyped and over-priced!”
Reviews.Author: awzhou
Reviews.Content: I echo the sentiments already posted about how this hotel is so over-hyped by the positive reviews. I arrived around 10pm for my 3-night stay due to airline delays. When checking in, the front desk apparently already gave up my room to someone else and it took > 30min to get things sorted out. As you can imagine having spend a whole day traveling to get to LA, I just wanted to get into my room and sleep! On check-in, I was also told that the valet parking rate had increased to $20 per day, not the $15 still posted on their website. The hotel is on a busy street and the windows are not well insulated so trying to get to sleep at night is challenging with all the traffic noise, which will also wake you up in the morning if you do manage to fall asleep! And what pool? It looked dinky and is smaller than the pool in my condo! Honestly, this is certainly not a 3* hotel and I regret the price I paid for it on Priceline ($105/night).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and it hit the spot”
Reviews.Author: Dennysteele
Reviews.Content: I was more than satisfied when I arrived at the Farmer's Daughter. Welcomed by a friendly reception and the smell of cookies. It's always a relief when check-in is swift and this certainly was. I felt so comfortable during my 48hr stay. I loved the room too which was very spacious.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug2011_11
Reviews.Content: Farmer's Daughter was an awesome hotel! It was very clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. And the restaurant "Tart" next door was very good. It is in a wonderful location too right across the street from The Grove shopping center and the farmer's market.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay at farmers daughter”
Reviews.Author: gogoamy
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed at the farmers daughter hotel for a week. this was my first trip to la, and from what i've been told it's in a great location. as a new yorker, i thought that meant there'd be plenty to do within walking distance, but found this wasn't the case. the farmers market and the grove are across the street which was nice, but pretty much everything else is driving distance, which i've come to learn is the la way. anyway. our stay was nice, the hotel staff was pleasant (although often non-existent in the lobby) and our room (a suite) was spacious and had a small kitchenette which was great to have. some minor complaints: hardwood floors in the rooms are VERY slippery which is problematic when traveling with a newly walking toddler as we were, hair dryer made awful noise and was basically non-functional, lighting in bathroom (and the whole room, really) was horrible - making it almost impossible to get ready for evenings out, crib had wheels and no brake so it kept rolling around the hardwood floors. i've seen other reviews where people have said the bed was uncomfortable, however we didn't feel that way at all - we actually slept amazingly every night.

Reviews.Title: “Almost prefect....”
Reviews.Author: DocMartinLondon
Reviews.Content: I am a return guest at Farmer's Daughter and love it there. Meets all my needs; location, hygene, internet, staff, rooms, TV, fascilities all 10/10 for me. Sadly for some strange reason when I arrived there had been a 'cancellation' on my booking....not by me!!! There was a record on the computer that a member of staff had cancelled my booking.....so, whilst they could accommodate me for my 1st & second night, they had to find me an alternative for one night and re-book me for the next 7.....not much fun! The manager, Peter, was helpful but the staff member on the desk at my arrival was useless: not much of an apology just a casual announcement that I'd have to find somewhere else to stay on Friday night. She then said she would look for somewhere for me, but forgot or was distracted so when I saw Peter the next day, he was a surprised as me that it wasn't done and had to make plans himself. Booked and paid for my one night stay in a local motel......nowhere near as nice as Farmers Daughter but a solution none the less. All in all, it was inconvenient and annoying but walk in rates were applied as a 'good will' gesture and the rest of my stay went smoothly and I will return again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent location but noisy road!”
Reviews.Author: elpereira
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely, the reception was really nice, across a courtyard with a restaurant terrace as well as a pool in a small shady corner though. Had a room on 1st floor and was lovely and spacious, nice vanity area outside the bathroom which was very useful, tiny bathroom with a shower cubicle and loo. We had a view of the 'Hollywood' sign from the door of our room!! Bed was comfy however I am a light sleeper and if there is any noise or light have trouble getting to sleep!! The road was quite a main road running outside the hotel and the noise seemed to continue all night with trucks and cars and buses, which did keep me awake, but my husband had no problems with it at all!! I had earplugs with me and put these in and that helped me get some sleep on and off. We walked across the road to the Farmers Market for dinners and breakfast - loads of choice and we found the brunch at Monsieur Marcel in the 'Real' Farmers Market fabulous, so we went back there in the evening for dinner and had Cheese Fondue - delicious!! We picked up the Hop-on Hop-off sightseeing bus from the Farmers market and did a tour of LA for the rest of the day. All in all the hotel is in a fab location and the room was lovely, bathroom a bit tiny, but adequate - only downside for me was road noise! They do have valet parking which was quite expensive, but all over LA, parking is expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Farmer's Daughter: always a good thing”
Reviews.Author: egerstan
Reviews.Content: This is our fifth time at the Farmers' Daughter and each time has been a pleasure. We love the location (near Museum Mile and across from the market/Grove). The staff is always pleasant and the room comfortable. We enjoy the great breakfasts at Tart (haven't tried it for dinner yet). And love the reasonable (for LA) rates! Our first choice when coming to LA!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, surprisingly great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: agilborder
Reviews.Content: When my husband told me the name of the hotel he had booked for me and my daughter, I thought he was joking. I come from the midwest where this could have been a scene out of "Hee Haw". My daughter informed me that this was going to be a hip LA boutique hotel (to which I replied "with farm implements? Really?"). But the FD totally exceeded my expectations. The pictures don't do it justice. Our room was very clean and while the atmosphere was farm kitch, it was really well done. Original art of farm animals and vegetables, galvanized bucket waste bins, rope rugs and bluejean bedspreads? Again, done very well for the shell of a room they had to work with. The "wood" floors were different, but you really have to have a good cleaning staff to keep them this dust free. The bathroom was immaculate and had cool lemongrass toiletries. I would definitely stay here again. There was a bit of noise since we were on a busy street, but didn't keep us up. The lobby complete with two very cute parakeets looks out on one of the most interesting succulent cactus gardens I have seen. Warmed by heaters, the perfect place to gather for a drink. Tart restaurant across the courtyard was delicious and very accommodating to my gluten allergy. The farmers market across the street is a destination in itself along with the shopping nearby. We stayed there because of the proximity to one of the consulates, but we found a lot to do. My only negative was that the beds had some weird squeaky material on them that squeaked whenever you moved (no I was with my daughter) but it would have put a quash on any FD romance!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff and great facilities”
Reviews.Author: Bedbugged
Reviews.Content: Stayed from January 27-30. As always the staff were very friendly, helpful and welcoming, and the rooms were spotlessly clean and had all the facilities anyone could ask for. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Farmer's Daughter is the One to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: MayhillSarah
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I decided to go to the Price is Right Game Show. I went in 1983 and remembered staying at a little hotel across the street from CBS. it was small then. It has totally been re-done and is so cute. The rooms are very Private, Safe and Comfortable and spotless. The Beds were great, we were able to sleep comfortably. The staff there was very nice and helpful. The wake up call was soooo cute, cockadoodle do hope you have a wonderful day! I thought that was wonderful!!!! The restaurant "Tart" has fablous food and is spotless. We had breakfast there, it was really good and they serve you more than enought to eat. Their omlets are wonderful. We had a bone in Ribeye Steak for dinner and I cannot begin to say how delicious it was. We have eaten steaks out alot but never never a steak like that. We had it the last day we were there and if I would have known about them sooner, I would have had to have one every day. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, it is so clean, neat and friendly and so convenient. All we had to do is walk across the street to CBS Studios and to the Farmer's Market and to the Mall which was close also. If we ever go back that way, I will definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Break out of the ordinary. Try someplace truly different & delightful”
Reviews.Author: RolandT84
Reviews.Content: The Farmer's Daughter is an old style motel that has been lovingly restored to a kitschy, retro modern hotel. The rooms are just a notch above plain, but the entire hotel has a vibe that is hard to describe, and resist. The staff and guests are overly friendly, they have a great restaurant on site with terrific outdoor seating. It's also just across the street from The Grove and the Farmer's Market, across from CBS, so "Price is Right" guest frequent the place. A short drive (or a brisk walk for non-LA guests) from Museum Row, Kanter's deli and many other sites. If you're tired of staying at cookie cutter hotels where you can't tell if you're in Cleveland or Canada from the inside, try this place. I think you'll like it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: cre8Louisville
Reviews.Content: The Farmer's Daughter Hotel is delightful. It is intimate, friendly and clean. We love the location since there is so much within walking distance---restaurants and shopping. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Themed Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TintinDC
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a two nights stay at the Farmer's Daughter hotel. Our stay was truly exceptional in just about every aspect. First, the location - between West Hollywood and the Fairfax district was hard to beat. Second, the small but inviting lobby sets the correct tone. The staff was very welcoming. There was lemonade and cookies for the taking. My wife had called a few days before our arrival to ask if there would be a crib available and the very helpful young man on the other end squared things away immediately. We arrived to find a crib in our room, set up with linens and bumper. The decor throughout the hotel is in keeping with a "Farmer's Daughter" who presumably makes her way to the big city while holding on to her rural roots. To that end our immaculately clean room contained a denim bedspread (changed each day), wood-plank flooring (no carpet, which we liked as it felt cleaner), a country-style desk -- and also a mini-fridge, a flat-screen tv, a dvd player... truly perfect. The bed and bedding were very comfortable. We enjoyed our stay very much. The one and only thing that was less than perfect was the attached restaurant- "Tart." Everything about "Tart" was great, except the food. A re-tooling of the kitchen is necessary. Bottom Line: We will stay at Farmer's Daughter again and will recommend it to friends without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great vibe in a great location”
Reviews.Author: misskimandgirls3
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my 3 daughters (aged 16, 13 & 9) at the end of a 3 week trip to the US. I found the staff very helpful, rooms really clean and exactly as described on the website. The location is excellent (right across the road from the Farmers Market and The Grove shopping centre), although the traffic was a little loud at night so next time I would ask for a room further away from Fairfax Ave. My girls really enjoyed the complimentary homemade lemonade and cookies in the foyer. The hotel has a trendy, laid back vibe thats fits in perfectly with the location. I will definatley be coming back again and would reccomend it to family and friends. so much more enjoyable than the larger "chain" hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LandofGoshen
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed so that we could attend The Price is Right Show and the Farmer's Daughter was great. We also ate in their Tart Restaurant for dinner and breakfast. It was safe, clean, quite and across the street from CBS. I tried to leave a review before but had it rejected as fake! Shame on you Trip Advisor. I am leaving my real name so that you know that this is a genuine review. Addie Nesbitt from CT.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: Teasmuggler
Reviews.Content: A funky motel in West Hollywood with a laid-back but slightly trendy vibe. Our first room was clean but smelled of paint thinner. The desk staff cheerfully changed our rooms and the second was fine. Bed was very comfortable, and free wireless internet had a nice strong signal. Just across the street from the Farmer's Market, a wonderful L.A. institution with lots of restaurants and shops. The only draw-back was the rate, very steep for what is a basic motel. Definitely stay here if you can book early or get a deal.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AT ALL COSTS!”
Reviews.Author: 32172Michael
Reviews.Content: From the reviews, we were expecting a pleasant if quirky small hotel. How wrong could we be! There were three problems, two of them major. The first was that the air conditioning was so noisy (and basic) that it woke us up every time it turned itself on (which was frequently). The second was that there was something in the room, which may have been mildew or some residue from cleaning products or the air conditioning system which caused a strong allergic reaction in my wife. The third was that when we complained the following morning, the hotel was totally unhelpful and devious and our attempts to speak to the management were frustrated at every turn. All we got was a message saying that there was no problem with our checking out and that we would get a refund for the nights we had not used followed by a later message saying that we would not get a refund but that we should arrange a charge back through the credit card company. When we tried to arrange this, the hotel responded by lying, saying among other things that we had not made the problem known to the front desk and that, had we done so they would have sorted everything out to our satisfaction, and then relying on the fact that we had made the reservation over the internet on a non-refundable basis and making it clear that they were going to keep our money. BEWARE THIS HOTEL! Beware also non-refundable deposits in general.

Reviews.Title: “great location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anna1834
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a great spot in West Hollywood, right opposite the grove and farmers market (*good for shopping and food) and there is a k-mart and wholefoods market right nearby as well. rooms are nice, we stayed in a double room for one night- cost was about US$160 and rooms were very clean and quite nice boutique hotel. i'd stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced -- Not Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: jmcmillen
Reviews.Content: This is an OK place to stay, but if it weren't for the location, I wouldn't recommend it at all. If you want to shop at the Grove, then this hotel might be for you. But keep in mind the rooms are nothing special. They're clean and the beds are comfy but that's about it. The hotel sits right next to a busy street so you'll hear traffic (and sirens) all night and you don't need an alarm clock -- the morning traffic will wake you up. Trust me. Essentially, this hotel has been marketed well. It's an old building that they slapped some paint on and came up with a theme to make it "unique". In terms of $250+ hotel, it's not even worth 1/2 that much. This really is a motel 8 type place with a brilliant marketing plan and comfortable beds. Tart, the restaurant next door is modern and has great service and food. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for The Price is Right.”
Reviews.Author: wwe_j_b_l
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night as I was attending a taping of The Price is Right the next day. Check-In was fast and efficient. The staff members were friendly and helpful when you had a question were things were. The Room: On first impression was unique. The rooms contained a television with DVD players, fridge, desk with chair, rocking chair. The room was clean. It was bright. The view was of a garage. The only complaint I have is that the bathroom tub could have been cleaner. There was hair in the tub. Also they provided no bath soap just face. Location: It was a short fare of about $15.00 to go to the Hollywood Walk of Fame. The reason on why you would stay here is to attend a taping of The Price is Right. It is located right across the street. It is right across from the Farmers Market. (I had a good breakfast at Du-Pars) The Price is Right Seminar: The hotel provides a seminar hosted by Ted in the lobby. It starts around 10:30. It is quite informative on what to expect. He has a lot of knowledge. Even if you are a friend and true of The Price is Right, you will enjoy this. Other: The Staff went out of there way to make your stay more enjoyable. They printed my boarding pass when the lobby computer had trouble. Also they store your luggage when your across the street at The Price is Right. No problem calling a cab for you as well. Overall: The hotel is in a great location for The Price is Right. I did find it on the expensive side of $189 for the night. It was worth it just for the location alone. The room was clean overall, and friendly staff. I wouldn't hesitate to stay hear again. Also the free lemonade was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “felt like home”
Reviews.Author: rileyboy99
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend was in town from San Francisco and we wanted to stay somewhere close to the Grove. This place was perfect, comfy, slept great, friendly front staff. We were only there one night, we did not check out the other places in the hotel but next time we will!

Reviews.Title: “Great location/Charming hotel/Excellent Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: jenw16
Reviews.Content: I had tickets for a concert at the Wiltern Theater and was concerned about finding a hotel via internet that is in a decent area. This hotel was perfect - right across from the Farmer's Market and The Grove and a little over 3 miles to the theater. A cab ride cost approx $15 plus tip each way. When I first got there, my thought was - oh, this is just an old motel that they refurbished to call a boutique hotel. But once I got settled in & looked around more, there really are some nice touches/decor. The comforter on the bed was super cozy, and the shower head was awesome. There's also a refrigerator in the room, and the hotel staff was friendly & helpful. Parking at the hotel is valet only - $19.80/nt. including tax. We dined outside at Tart (their restaurant) in the evening, and it looked magical outside. Simply gorgeous. The waitress was super friendly & patient (couldn't decide which yummy drink to order!). Overall it was a very positive experience - excellent location, great restaurant, and nice hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SydneyEle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed for 3 nights, 11/26-11/29. I chose it for the location to the Farmer's Market and The Grove. I was VERY happy with my choice and would love to stay again. It was SO cold when we were there so the heater in the room was lovely. The room was a good size and had a great feel to it. A hessian curtain separates the bedroom and bathroom and the quilt cover is denim so there are a few nice little country touches. During the day there was free fresh lemonade and crisps and later some cookies and hot spiced cider which was really nice. Of course just walking across the road to The Farmer's Market was very convenient, especially after staying for karaoke and too many drinks on the Friday night! The staff were just right, friendly without being too over bearing or in your face which I prefer. We didn't dine at Tart. Parking was easy and valet for $18 per day. I drove to the ice hockey and the basketball at The Staples Center and found it a fairly easy, quick drive. Oh and our room had a mirrored ceiling which was ummmm fun! We were in room 101 which was next to the road, but we found it quiet and easy to sleep. Overall we LOVED this hotel and hope to be back one day when we pay off our credit cards from this vacation. Ele :-)

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: AlexKlagenfurt
Reviews.Content: Charming, cosy and pleasant hotel, very clean, friendly staff, very good breakfast

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: navraq
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Farmer's Daughter for one night but wish I'd booked the other three nights of my LA area stay there. I chose it for convenience as I was attending a taping of the Late Late Show and the CBS studio is directly across the street. The Farmers Market is in walking distance as well - so nice to ditch the car. Valet costs were somewhere between 18 and 20 a night (I think it was 18). No choice to park yourself but that fee isn't bad for LA from what I have seen. Clean, roomy accommodations with comfortable bed. Helpful and friendly staff all around. it seems trendy but you'll like it even if you're not.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location in an inviting environment”
Reviews.Author: TomFromOZ
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful and the location of the hotel right across the road from the Farmer's Market is unbeatable. Great Public Transport connections (yes, Public Transport in LA - $1.25 for a bus ride is brilliant!), and any number of attractions within easy walking distance (LACMA, Peterson Museum). Great shopping if you are that way inclined - Melrose, Beverley Centre, Rodeo - all easily accessible. Staff were brilliant and the rooms are quaint and very well serviced. The restaurant attached would be the only area for improvement, but not too sure if this associated anyway...This will be my place to stay in LA!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Quirky, Clean, GREAT Restaurant, Wonderful Location.”
Reviews.Author: HOLLYSMILES
Reviews.Content: I loved the Farmer's Daughter and I would definitely stay in this hotel again. The daily breakfast was wonderful outdoors, get the steel cut oatmeal with fresh fruit or the pancakes if you want to splurge... And it's in an amazing location, close to everything and we could walk across the street to the farmers' market and outdoor shopping area to see movies, shop (Anthropologie, World Market, Barnes & Noble, Nordstrom, J.Crew, Henry Bendel, etc.) and eat from incredible local sellers with carts filled with local delicacies from fish tacos to cupcakes and everything in between (Indian, Japanese, you name it). I felt safe at the Farmer's Daughter and I loved the super clean rooms and the great high-speed internet connection which was perfect since I was on a business trip and relied on the internet each day. Excellent place, I'd stay here again in a heartbeat! You can see my review in full and photos here: http://decor8blog.com/2010/07/23/travel-notes-from-los-angeles/

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good Food and Mostly Good Service!”
Reviews.Author: kdgrider
Reviews.Content: It was a bit hard to find when driving down the street for the first time. The hundred blocks jump around, but look for the TART sign glowing pink, that is the hotels restaurant. We valet parked and headed to check in. We were going to a concert a few hours later and let the valet know so he parked it up front for easy access when we left! (very nice!) The lady at the counter was great. She was knowledgable of the area and pretended to care about our vacation! We made it up to our room on the top floor (3rd floor) of the main bldg. which was suppose to be a bit noisier then the "barn" rooms because it was attached to the lobby however we had no noise complaints at all and for a friday night that is saying alot! Before our concert we ate at the hotel restaurant TART. We were greeted and seated right away. It is a tight squeeze inside but nice and there is outside seating in a private area between the hotel lobby and the restaurant doors. The staff was very pleasant with great customer service skills. Many people were working in order to keep everyone happy on a busy friday night! OK, this is where the mostly good service comes in... We were out until about 2am, after the concert we ate at a great little 24 hr restaurant/deli not too far from the hotel. On the way back to the hotel I called to make sure valet was still aval and of course it was 24hrs but was told to come to the lobby because the valet was also security at this time. We tried to use our room key to open the doors that connect the parking area to the lobby and they had bolt locked it. So we had to walk around front (which even though it is an ok neighborhood I would rather not do at 2am anywhere) it was a bit frustrating. Then when we got to the lobby the staff was very unpleasant (the lady working the desk and the security/valet) They were rude and some what bothered by us disturbing their naps (?) We then gave him our key and started to our room. We heard him rev the engine a few times in the process and squeal. We were able to view him parking the vehicle however and satisfied that he didn't hit anything along the way we decided to go to bed. There were plenty of comfy pillows and the bed was very comfortable too. The room was very cute and a good size. Overall we had a great time but don't expect to get the best customer service at 2am (I guess they have those kind of people working that shift because they assume they will not be dealing with too many customers?)

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced poorly executed!”
Reviews.Author: tetstb
Reviews.Content: The basic theme of the hotel is a farm and the rooms are supposed to be barn themed with cute curtains etc. The truth of the matter is that the rooms are basic, poorly furnished with basic wooden chairs and a very uncomfortable bed. The general room cleanliness is average but I did notice some left over hairs on the bathroom floor! The rooms are equipped with an LCD flatscreen TV and basic cable, wireless or wired Internet, a coffee machine, small fridge and an iron. That's about it, the bathroom is very basic and the shower is of the old fixed head type so pretty unremarkable. In general this is an obvious attempt to charge boutique hotel rates for nothing more than basic motel standards.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and inviting”
Reviews.Author: azazzi
Reviews.Content: Really friendly staff who made you feel like you were staying at their home. The location is GREAT! All kinds of food and shopping within walking distance. My wife and I got some ice cream and rode the trolly back and forth at the grove.

Reviews.Title: “Most convenient location, adorable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bxroo52
