The place is faithful to its roots, a bit camp, a little rock’n’roll and perfectly positioned – right across the road from the Farmers Market and The Grove mall and all the sights to see in the Wilshire district – the tar pits, Petersen Auto Museum, the Ambassador Hotel, the Seinfeld apartment block, and Macarthur Park. Staff were great, friendly and helpful, the rooms were comfortable with some delightful touches like a rocking chair. You may noticed a little traffic noise but with the price and the style it was worth the just the smallest annoyance. I’ll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Neat - O”
Reviews.Author: LTKING
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Farmer's Daughter last Saturday night. This place is a trip! The lobby is really cute, with the farm theme. It cracked me up when the clerk emerged from behind the back wearing overalls and a checkered shirt. This hotel appears to have been a converted 50's LA motor/hotel. The way they modernized it with the country/hip theme is quite neat. I loved the picture of the hound on the bedroom wall. Yes, as other reviewers said, there is no view. I didn't go for the view, I went for the location - and it is a good, central location. There is valet parking steps away from the registration desk.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Overalls!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Farmers Daughter was an fun and unique experience. The staff was not only friendly and accomodating but gosh darn Hee Haw cute! The Farmer's Daughter offers a lot of bang for your buck. Confortable, casual, and affordable. Make sure before you check out that you get one of those T-Shirts!

Reviews.Title: “Looks Great but run like a Motel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The look is great, a total overhaul has made this a cool alternative hotel. The Hotel is run by the strong arm of Motel rules though, don't ask to leave after 12pm or they will quote the "Rule" that does not allow for a later check out without you paying for another night (I asked for a 1pm check out). The kid at the desk thought calling me dude would make up for it but by the time he rolled his eyes for the third time I was over it. You can dress the Farmer's Daughter up, but you can't run her like a real hotel!

Reviews.Title: “'Come On Down'- show prep great!”
Reviews.Author: JoeFriday
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nites mid Jan 2005. CBS security guard recommended when we asked about hotels. We came to LA to go on Price is Right and this is certainly the place to stay if going on that show. Right across the street from where you line up at 4am. One of the hotel desk clerks gives a nightly detailed presentation on how to get picked from the audience and other helpful tips. Our room was clean and fun. Decor is Farmer funky. Even the staff dress like farmers- courtyard is nice place to hang out as is the lobby. Nice looking pool that was closed because it was Jan. Great shopping and dining center right across the street "Farmer's Market". Also near Hollywood and Rodeo Drive, etc. definitely need a car. $10 mandatory valet parking is only negative but we'd stay again as it was a clean place and staff was escellent- Even if we didin't get picked on Price is Right!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Limehouse2002
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Farmer's Daughter last December for 10 nights. The hotel is in a great location, clean, funky and inviting. The staff were nothing but helpful; when we decided to extend our stay they advised us to book the additional 5 nights online as it would be cheaper. My only moan is the cost of valet parking but I acknowledge this is part of LA culture and it could be far higher. We will certainly stay at the Farmer's Daughter again. A really great place!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After the back and forth reviews I've read on this hotel, I was a little sketchy about having made reservations. All doubts were put to rest, this is a GREAT little hotel! The staff is excellent and knowledgable. (I would ask the night guy not to be so negative however. He seemed to delight in the fact that he could worry people into thinking they just MIGHT not actually have gotten into line for the Price is Right early enough.) The rooms are clean and spacious. Great waterfall showers in the bath. Fantastic bath products! Don't miss the fridge in the room. It is hidden in a cupboard under the tv and it was an entire day before we realized it was there. Lovely patio both upstairs and down. CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN! Do yourself a favor and reserve early on the internet to get the best price, but you can't go wrong staying here. The line for the PRICE IS RIGHT begins right across the street, Canters is just down the road with fantastic food, and The Grove and Farmers Market are just a stones throw away.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and fun...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at Farmer's daughter. The hotel was laid back and fun and the room was cozy and cute. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do not let the kitsch factor of Farmer's Daughter put you off. This charming hotel is in the perfect location making travel to West Hollywood and Beverly Hills easily accesible. The decor is cute, but most importantly this hotel is trendy, new, fresh and modern. There's no need to withstand the snootiness of "upscale" hotels when the Farmer's Daughter has every ammenity you could ask for without the attitude. Making the location even more ideal, right across the street is the Grove and Farmer's Market loaded with shopping and restaurants. Museums are in walking distance. The staff is helpful in making recommendations, and you receive a map upon check-in. I will not stay anywhere else when in LA!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Farmers Daughter”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Cute place, great location. I always stay there while I'm in LA.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I stayed at in the US!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We moved to the Farmers Daughter from a terrible hostel down the road that we couldn't bear any longer, and it was a pleasure to stay there. The room was so fresh and new, with the comfiest bed, lovely linen and great bathroom products. The staff were super friendly and efficient, and the location is great because it's right opposite the Farmer's Market and The Grove. At first I wished they had a restaurant but there are heaps of places to eat across the road. Especially the pancakes at the nearby diner...i forget its name. If I have other friends visiting the US I will definitely tell them to stay at this hotel. I hope it stays this nice!

Reviews.Title: “Good place, with some caveats”
Reviews.Author: wanderer
Reviews.Content: My family and I basically liked the Farmers Daughter. That was especially true once the three of us moved from a room with two (small) double beds to a room with a king and a rollaway. The hotel refused to put a rollaway in the room with the two double beds, arguing--probably correctly--that there wasn't enough room. I liked the decor, I don't think it did much for my wife or daughter, though my wife noted the cleanliness value of hardwood floors. The bathrooms were very minimal, a tight flourescent lit space with a toilet and bathtub, though the sinks with their "waterfall" faucets were outside the bathroom. There were two main clerks on duty during our 3 days there--one was fine, the other seemed to come from Slacker Central Casting. Darkness at night--good. The soundproofing was so so, especially when we moved to the larger room closer to Fairfax Ave., but we ran the fan on the heating system and that drowned out traffic. The bed comfort was good, though the rollaway was a bit too springy. My wife was unhappy that the first room had only one chair--the second room had a chair and a rather steeply canted rocking chair. The location is good. The Farmers Market is right across the street and has a bunch of places to both buy fresh food and some very good stands selling prepared food--restaurant level places. You can walk to some other places in the Fairfax, such as the enormous LA County Museum. It's also a short drive to interesting city areas--Hollywood Boulevard, Beverly Hills, West Hollywood etc. There are hardly any other tourist grade hotels in the area, so it's a bit hard to compare prices.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Experience”
Reviews.Author: biztravelguy
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very fun and the bed was comfortable. The hardwood floors were a new experience for a hotel room, but fit in well with the design. It is a very country cottage feel in all the rooms. There is also free high-speed internet in the room...great perk! The staff was VERY FRIENDLY and they made the stay very enjoyable. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Some positives, more negatives”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First note: PARKING IS NO LONGER FREE. They charge $7.70 a day to park, and you have to hand your car over to a greasy valet every time you arrive. Positives: The hotel is quaint and located well, across the street from the Farmer's Market and Grove entertainment/shopping center, as well as two miles from either Hollywood or Beverly Hills. Right across from The Price is Right if you want to do that. High-speed Internet access, DVD player, coffee maker and fridge. Hot showers with good water pressure. Decent price. Negatives: Rooms are small. Bathroom is tiny. TV is so small that you won't want to watch DVDs on it. Wood floors are dirty and cold. Walls are thin. A few ants in bathroom. The parking fee and required valet. It is definitely a glorified motel.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, Comfy and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: indiegemsfilms
Reviews.Content: As a Film and Television Producer, I frequently travel back and forth from NY to Hollywood. I usually stay at the Standard Hotel. I heard that the Farmer’s Daughter was recently renovated so I tried it. I was impressed with the new look, the location, and the rates. Not only was the suite, comfortable and trendy, including a modest kitchenette, HBO and a DVD player, and a spa-like shower, but also the staff was attentive to my needs round the clock. The location was a big plus. Being across from the Farmers Market and The Grove allowed me to conveniently hold numerous breakfast and lunch meetings there. I encourage any “cost conscience” person to check out the “Farmer’s Daughter”! Cost and Location, Location, Location will surely impress.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the price! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a two night stay at the Farmer's Daughter and had a wonderful experience there. If you're traveling to L.A. for a chance to be on The Price is Right, this is an excellent choice -- their location directly across the street from the CBS studios makes your long wait in line much better. They'll even rent you a chair so you don't have to sit on the pavement while you wait in line! Don't miss Ted's free nightly Price is Right seminar at 10:20 PM -- full of good info and tips! The rooms were VERY clean (and I'm picky about that!), they offer free high-speed internet access (if you forget your ethernet cable, you can check one out for free at the front desk), and free DVD rentals (for your in-room DVD player). The beds were comfortable, and the water pressure was great. Nice minty bath products from Lather too! The L.A. Farmer's Market a block down the road offers a ton of inexpensive food choices, and you're within walking distance of Canter's famous deli. Book through their website rather than over the phone for an additional discount. We will definitely stay here again the next time we visit L.A.!

Reviews.Title: “Would be nice if they cleaned...”
Reviews.Author: BarefootTom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week -- a LONG week. The hotel is dirty. The floors are filthy. There are ants. The location is great - across from the Farmers Market area and the mall. However, in the immediate area there are better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Annoying Parking Policy”
Reviews.Author: froome
Reviews.Content: While our stay here was very good due to an excellent location and warm, attentive staff, the hotel has started a new policy that I found annoying. Valet parking is now the only option for your car ($7.70 charge). I was not expecting this as I found no information on the web regarding a parking fee nor was I told of this policy when I spoke to them prior to making a reservation. I had to unload my car in the driveway, hand my keys over to the valet, haul my suitcase and miscellaneous items across the courtyard only to later find my car parked in front of my room and me without a key for access. I was told that the valet parking is required by the city of Los Angeles as they are in the process of opening a restaurant. Other than this inconvenience, our stay here was very comfortable.

HotelInfo.Name: Farmer's Daughter Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 115 S. Fairfax Ave., Los Angeles, CA 90036
